name: TV Eateries Quiz | Things in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: This is the bar "where everybody knows your name".
questions.explanation:
Cheers.

	Especially if your name is Norman.

questions.text: "Friends": the name of the coffee shop where the 6 friends meet.
questions.explanation:
Central Perk.

	Phoebe didn't get the punny nature of the name for several seasons, even though she played guitar there regularly.

questions.text: "Star Trek: The Next Generation": The name of the lounge that Guinan (Whoopi Goldberg) tended aboard Enterprise.
questions.explanation:
Ten Forward.

	Whoopi was inspired to go into acting by the presense of Lt. Uhura (Nichelle Nichols) on the original "Star Trek" series.

questions.text: The coffee shop in Seattle where Frasier and Niles Crane meet quite often.
questions.explanation:
Cafe Nervosa.

	They almost always give the waiter a complicated order.

questions.text: The diner that Alice Hyatt worked at in "Alice".
questions.explanation:
Mel's.

	She took a job there when her car broke down halfway through Arizona.

questions.text: "Three's Company": The name of the pub they frequented.
questions.explanation:
The Regal Beagle.

	Starred Suzanne Somers, Joyce DeWitt, and the late John Ritter.

questions.text: "Three's a Crowd": The name of the bistro Jack opened: Jack's ______.
questions.explanation:
Bistro.

	The short-lived sequel to "Three's Company".

questions.text: "The Simpsons": The name of the bar that Homer frequents.
questions.explanation:
Moe's.

	Bart is always calling the bar with prank phone calls.

questions.text: "Kim Possible": what type of food does Kim and Ron's favorite restaurant serve?
questions.explanation:
Mexican.

	The restaurant is Bueno Nacho.

questions.text: "The Weekenders": the friends' favorite restaurant changes names and themes every episode, but serves the same type of food.  What type of food does it serve?
questions.explanation:
Pizza.

	Tino, Lor, Carver, and Tish go there every weekend.
